name: replot
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mathematics
  specialized to plot (= make marks to show the position, movement or development of) something again, for example, because new information has become available: The data was replotted, and the result is shown in the graph in Figure 8. The captain assessed the effect of the ocean currents and replotted the course. Related word
plot verb (MARK)
to make a new plan that is different from an earlier one: After this staggering defeat, the team has only four days to replot its strategy. Some of these new designs have made people want to completely replot their interiors.
More examplesFewer examplesWe changed the numbers and replotted the curve.Laying out these intervals along the baseline, we replotted the data.When a parameter is changed, the equation is immediately re-evaluated, and any related graph is re-plotted.
